intro: Chelyorchis malphigioides, commonly known as the Malphigioid buttercup, is a striking plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many showy flowering plants. The species is characterized by its bright yellow, cup-shaped flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. It thrives in moist, rocky habitats and is often found in alpine environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
